title: Cameron: migrants on spousal visas may have to leave if English doesn't improve - Politics live | Politics | The Guardian
summary: warsi says accuses cameron of 'stereotyping ' muslims .
labour mp naz shah says cameron right about muslim women needing to learn english .
burnham says cameron at risk of 'unfairly stigmatising ' muslim community .
cameron suggests met should apologise to lord bramall for its abuse investigation .
cameron signals he plans a new law to assert the supremacy of parliament over eu law .

documents.title: afternoon summary
text: kevan jones , who resigned recently as a shadow defence minister , has described jeremy corbyn 's suggestion that nuclear submarines could be retained without having to carry warheads at all times as ill-informed '' .

speaking during defence questions , he asked the government : would you agree that it 's not just about the number of jobs involved in the successor programme but the high-skilled nature of those jobs ?
despite ill-informed comments from my own party at the weekend with regards to these jobs , would you also agree with me that simply you ca n't turn them on and off like a tap when you need them ?
philip dunne , a defence minister , said jones was right about this .
it 's a sorry state to see you sitting right at the back of the back benches today .

you are of course quite right to point out that this is a long-term endeavour , to design and build a nuclear-enabled submarine takes decades and this is a 35-year project from initial conception to commissioning .
and that those skills not only take a long time to develop , they ca n't be switched on and off , and they are the very forefront of engineering capability in this country .
building a nuclear submarine is more difficult than sending a man to the moon .
mps are getting ready to debate a call for donald trump to be excluded from the uk .
i will be covering that now on a separate blog .
mps debate call for donald trump to be banned from the uk - live read more that 's all for today on this blog .
thanks for the comments .
in the commons it is defence questions .
michael fallon , the defence secretary , has just welcomed his new opposite number , emily thornberry , to her post .

he said he regretted the loss of her mainstream , moderate '' ( ie pro-trident ) predecessors , maria eagle , who was moved from shadow defence to shadow culture , and kevan jones , who resigned as a shadow defence minister .

documents.title: lunchtime summary
text: migrants who fail language tests after two and a half years in the uk may be forced to leave , david cameron has said , as he announced plans to encourage greater integration of muslim women .

speaking later in leeds , where he visited a mosque and a women 's centre , he said : the evidence is that there are some 40,000 women in our country who really do n't speak any english at all and , perhaps altogether , some 190,000 with very poor english .

i think it 's quite right to say to people who come to our country that there are many rights that you have here - it 's a fantastic country to live in - but there are also obligations that we should put on people who come to our country , and chief amongst them should be obligations to learn english because then you can integrate , you can take advantage of the opportunities here and you can help us to build the strong country that we want .
lady warsi , the conservative former party chairman , has joined labour and the lib dems in criticising cameron for linking failure to speak english with radicalisation .
david cameron talks with imam qari asim ( right ) , and shabana muneer , a member of makkah masjid mosque 's women 's group , as he visits makkah masjid mosque in leeds .
scarff/afp/getty images cameron has repeated the threat to impose a new contract on junior doctors without their consent , arguing they can not be allowed to block progress in our nhs '' .
cameron has criticised the bbc again for using the term islamic state '' , saying muslim people would be holding their heads in despair .
the steel industry and trade unions have called on the government to defend the sector after tata steel announced more than 1,000 job cuts at its uk business .
frank field , the labour chair of the commons work and pensions committee , has said government plans to reform welfare to make work more attractive are in ruins '' .
publishing a report on welfare reform for the thinktank civitas ( pdf ) , field said the glacial '' roll-out of universal credit meant tax credits would remain in place until at least 2020 .
it is in the fate of universal credit , and the changes that have been made to the original ideas , that we see the collapse of the government 's strategy to make work the best route out of poverty .

this judgment is not based simply upon the minute number of people claiming universal credit - there were barely 75,000 claimants by the 2015 general election when 1.7m was the goal - and its minimal impact on welfare expenditure .
because of universal credit 's higher taper rate for many claimants , the strategy of fixing 'broken britain ' by offering lower withdrawal rates than the current system lies in ruins .
universal credit fails to incentivise the work on which the 'broken britain ' analysis was built .
if creating an incentive to work is the goal , the present system , for the vast majority of claimants , meets that goal more effectively .
arron banks , co-chair of the leave.eu campaign , has said dominic cummings , campaign director of vote leave , is the only obstacle to a merger between the two rival organisations .
in an open letter to vote leave 's chief executive , matthew elliott , banks said the two groups should discuss uniting .
as i have said previously , the only person apparently standing in the way of a formal merger is dominic cummings .

with his latest comments suggesting the prime minister use anything other than article 50 of the lisbon treaty to initiate our withdrawal from the eu , he has become a liability and a danger to both leave campaigns .

i have stressed before the importance of having one united 'leave ' campaign as i believe it is counter-productive to the end goal that we are both deploying resources on grassroots activists and the media .

i therefore extend my hand , again , for us to open up talks about how we can move forward as one unstoppable campaign devoted to securing a leave vote and only a leave vote in the one and only referendum we will have .

grassroots out , a third campaign for leaving the eu , has announced it will formally launch on saturday at an event attended by mps and meps from the conservatives ( peter bone , tom pursglove and philip hollobone ) , labour ( kate hoey ) , ukip ( nigel farage and margot parker ) and the dup ( sammy wilson ) .
the raf has carried out a further strike in syria using the hi-tech brimstone missile to attack islamic state targets .

as the press association reports , the ministry of defence confirmed tornado gr4s used the brimstone missiles to destroy a vehicle in tabbaqah , west of raqqa , in syria and a terrorist supply truck south of sinjar in iraq on sunday .
as you may have seen , the guardian has launched a major , four-week project investigating the state of the nhs .
it is one of the most ambitious projects we 've ever attempted .
you can read the full coverage here .
and here is a live blog reporting from st george 's hospital in south london .
this is the nhs : live from the frontline at st george 's hospital in south london read more
tim farron , the lib dem leader , has accused david cameron of dog-whistle politics '' .
referring to cameron 's language plans for muslim women , farron said : this announcement is dog-whistle politics at its best .
david cameron cut the budget for english language classes in august last year by 45 million .
now the prime minister is dressing up a massive cut as a 20 million funding commitment .
linking women in the muslim community who struggle with the english language to home-grown extremism only serves to isolate the very people cameron says he is trying to help .
liberal democrats support english language classes for anyone regardless of race , religion or gender and blocked these plans to cut funding for them in coalition .
my colleague alan travis , the guardian 's home affairs editor , has written an analysis of david cameron 's plan to get more muslim women to speak english .
like lady warsi , he thinks cameron was wrong to link this issue with radicalisation .
here 's an extract .
david cameron is right to make an extra £ 20m available for english language teaching for new migrants .

he did , after all , preside over much deeper funding cuts in 2011 for english language classes that have left new migrants on 1,000-plus waiting lists for courses at their local adult education colleges .
but the prime minister is wrong to link the issue of integrating a small proportion of new migrants who ca n't speak english , with that of tackling extremism .
after all , speaking perfect english does n't appear to be a big problem for those british jihadis in islamic state 's videos .
and here 's the full article .
cameron should be careful of linking english skills and extremism read more

documents.title: warsi says accuses cameron of 'stereotyping ' muslims
text: lady warsi , the conservative former party chair and former faith and communities minister , has expressed reservations about some aspects of david cameron 's plan to get more muslim women speaking english .
she said she was in favour of spending money on english teaching , but she criticised the decision to link the language problem with radicalisation .
this is what she told the evening standard .

once again an important policy announcement has been tarnished by lazy and misguided links to extremism and terrorism resulting once again in stereotyping britain 's muslims communities as different and outsiders .
and this is what she has posted on twitter .
sayeeda warsi ( @ sayeedawarsi ) .
women should have the opportunity to learn english full stop .
why link it to radicalisation/ extremism/ ct ?

@ twitterid @ twitterid sayeeda warsi ( @ sayeedawarsi ) women should learn english to get a job , help kids with homework , manage their own finances , get a driving lic list is endless but ct� sayeeda warsi ( @ sayeedawarsi ) and why should it just be muslim women who have the opportunity to learn english ?

why not anyone who lives in the uk and ca n't speak english sayeeda warsi ( @ sayeedawarsi ) ps mums english is n't great yet she inspired her girls to become a lawyer , teacher , accountant , pharmacist , cabinet minister # womenpower

documents.title: no 10 lobby briefing - summary
text: here are the main points from the number 10 lobby briefing .
downing street provided further details of how the government will toughen language requirements for people who come to the uk on a spousal visa .
under current rules , people need to meet the a1 english standard to gain admittance , the prime minister 's spokesman said .
she was referring to a1 on the common european framework of reference for languages ( cefr ) .
after five years , people are expected to have reached the b1 level under the current rules .
under the new plan announced by the prime minister , they will now be expected to have reached the a2 level after two and a half years .
that will be assessed by the uk border agency , as part of the visa process .
the spokeswoman said that it was reasonable '' to expect people coming here to improve their language and that this was part of their having responsibilities as well as rights .
the spokewoman would not say how many women were expected to lose their right to remain in the uk under the beefed-up rules announced by cameron .
the spokeswoman said the job losses announced by tata steel were part of a broader global crisis affecting the steel industry '' .
the price of some steel had almost halved over the last year , she said , and european steel demand had not returned to the level it was before the financial crisis .

she said that the government had taken steps to help the steel industry , such as getting eu approval under state aid rules to compensate steel producers for the higher charges imposed on energy-intensive industries , and that it would be working with the welsh government to help those communities affected by today 's job losses .

the spokeswoman refused to discuss reports that the eu definition of a worker '' may be changed as part of cameron 's eu renegotiation to enable the uk to stop eu migrants claiming in-work benefits for four years .
but she said the government was getting good momentum and engagement '' ahead of the eu summit next month where it is hoped the renegotiation deal will be finalised .
the spokeswoman said that cameron was deeply concerned '' about the allegations of match-fixing in tennis .
those allegations should be investigated , she said .
she said this highlighted the need , more broadly , to tackle the issue of corruption , and that cameron would be addressing that with an anti-corruption summit later this month .
10 downing street neal/afp/getty images
i 'm back from the number 10 lobby briefing , and will post a summary soon .
in the meantime , andy burnham , the shadow home secretary , has put out a statement about cameron 's drive to get muslim women to speak english .
he said : in his desire to grab easy headlines , david cameron risks doing more harm than good .
his clumsy and simplistic approach to challenging extremism is unfairly stigmatising a whole community .
there is a real danger that it could end up driving further radicalisation , rather than tackling it .
the prime minister is right to talk about empowering women but his emphasis should be on women of all faiths and none .
his commitment to english classes is welcome but people will ask why his government has spent the last few years cutting funding from these vital courses .
tackling extremism is the greatest challenge of our age .
we are willing to work with the government to get it right .
but it is a deep-rooted and complex problem and requires a more sophisticated approach than we have seen to date and a stronger sense of partnership with the muslim community .
labour is committed to achieving that as a genuine alternative to this government 's counter-productive approach .

we will soon be launching a new initiative working with the muslim community to develop a better understanding of the issues and empowering it to tackle the very small minority at risk of radicalisation .
david cameron must proceed with more care and thought than he is currently showing and labour will continue to challenge him to get the balance and tone right .
david cameron is doing a visit today to promote his learn english initiative .
but , according to sky 's gerard tubb , it 's not going well .
gerard tubb ( @ tubbsky ) `` can we talk to these women ? ''
pm 's office : `` no , not before the pm arrives '' `` afterwards ? ''
`` there wo n't be any time '' gerard tubb ( @ tubbsky ) this gets worse .
the pm will not talk to us here at all .
`` he might do a clip if we go to a mosque later '' gerard tubb ( @ tubbsky ) i 'm being held in a room .
pm next door now with women .
we will be given 60 '' in the room and not allowed to ask qs i 'm off to the lobby briefing now .
i will post again after 11.30am .

documents.title: labour mp naz shah says cameron right about muslim women needing to learn english
text: naz shah , the labour mp for bradford west , said the poor standard of english among many women in her constituency was a huge barrier to integration '' .
ten per cent of residents in bradford west ca n't speak english at all or not well '' , according to the 2011 census .
in one inner city ward , manningham , that figure is 22 % .shah , whose own mother came over from pakistan and could speak only broken english , said she welcomed david cameron 's proposal .
too many children in bradford and elsewhere are starting school with no english because it is not spoken at home , and that has a knock-on effect for their education .
early years education starts in the home .
she said some in the pakistani community seemed to be going backwards .
when my parents came over , my mum had to learn the basics in order to get by .

now , with the third and fourth generations , it 's perfectly possible to live a life where you never have to speak english because everyone in the shops and services where you live speak your language have we actually undone some of the good work that has been done in terms of integration ?

men were sometimes to blame for women not learning english , she said : let 's be clear , we do have patriarchal pockets in our communities which wo n't and do n't support women going out and being confident and partaking in civil society because they want that patriarchal structure to continue .
but shah pointed out that at the same time as urging immigrants to learn english , cameron had also cut funding for esol teaching ( english for speakers of other languages ) .

in july , the skills funding agency announced all funding for esol plus mandation '' would be cut as part of the £ 450m in savings that the department for business , innovation and skills has been asked to find by the treasury .
these were introduced to require jobseeker 's allowance claimants with poor spoken english to improve their language skills in order to continue receiving benefits .
some 47 colleges and about 16,000 learners are affected by the cuts , according to the association of colleges ( aoc ) .
you ca n't on the one hand talk about instilling british values in immigrants at the same time as cutting funding to help them learn english so they can learn our values , '' said shah .
naz shah .
/rex shutterstock

documents.title: david cameron 's today interview - full summary
text: here is a full summary of the main points from david cameron 's today interview .
i 've taken some of the quotes from the press association .
cameron said women coming to the uk on a spousal visa could lose their right to stay in the country if they did not improve their english .
new rules would come into force from october , he said , and these would involve people with poor english having their language ability tested after two and a half years .
if they were not improving , there would be no guarantee of their staying , he said .
it is not just muslim women .
it is when people come under a spousal visa , because they are marrying someone who 's already here , that after two and a half years they should be improving their english .
and we will be testing that .
i think that 's important .
when asked if this meant that a woman who came here and had children could be forced to leave if she failed the test , he said this was a possibility .

they ca n't guarantee that they will be able to stay because under our rules you have to be able to speak a basic level of english now to be able to come into the country as a husband or a wife ; we made that change already .

and we are now going to toughen that up so half way through the five year spousal settlement programme , two and a half years , there will be another opportunity to make sure that your english is improving .
and you can not guarantee that you will be able to stay if you are not improving your language .
he said he supported the right of women to wear a full-face veil , although he said he also backed the right of schools and courts to impose sensible '' rules on this .
i think in our country people should be free to wear what they like and , within limits , live how they like and all the rest of it .

what does matter , if for instance a school has a particular uniform policy , sensitively put in place and all the rest of it , and people want to flout that uniform policy , often for reasons that are n't really connected with religion , i think you should always come down on the side of the school .
cameron said the same principle applied in courts , or at border controls .
but he would not back a french-style burqa ban , he said .
going for the french approach of banning an item of clothing , i do not think that 's the way we do things in this country and i do not think that would help .
he said he accepted that not speaking english did not cause extremism , but he said growing up in an english-free home could increase the chances of children being drawn into extremism .
i am not saying there is some sort of causal connection between not speaking english and becoming an extremist , of course not .
that would be a ridiculous thing to say .

but if you are not able to speak english , not able to integrate , you may find therefore you have challenges understanding what your identity is and therefore you could be more susceptible to the extremist message .
he defended the government 's decision to cut funding for english lessons in the last parliament .
we had to make difficult decisions .
now what we are doing is targeting the language money much more accurately .
he said the new £ 20m english classes being announced today were not just for muslim women , but for women in the greatest danger of isolation . ''
cameron said he was planning a new law to assert the supremacy of parliament over eu law .

asked about a story in the sunday times yesterday saying he was planning to legislate to make it clear that domestic law was sovereign , cameron said the government had already addressed this point in the referendum act in 2010 , which said powers could not be transferred to brussels without a referendum .

then he went on : if it is necessary to do that again , in more detail , to make it even clearer to people that our parliament is sovereign asked if he thought it was necessary , he replied : i think there is a good case for it so we will look very carefully at that .
the sunday times said michael gove , the justice secretary , had already been asked to draw up a bill on this .
asked about this , cameron said : i do n't want to go into my individual conversations with individual ministers , but he is the lord chancellor and responsible for a lot of these legal issues .
the whole government is working together on these plans .
cameron suggested the metropolitan police should apologise to lord bramall for its handling of the investigation into abuse allegations against him .
he said he hoped the met was big enough '' to accept what went wrong and offer bramall some comfort '' .
[ lord bramall ] is a wonderful man with a great record of serving our country and i think what happened to him would have been very distressing .

i think it is very difficult for a prime minister to get involved in these arguments because the police and the prosecuting services must be free to follow the evidence where it leads and go after people , no matter how high and mighty they are .

but if they feel they get it wrong , i hope they can feel big enough to give people some comfort afterwards prime ministers ca n't go around ordering the police to apologise here or the prosecutors to drop this prosecution .
we are a country of independent institutions .
the police are independent - they ca n't be ordered around by me .
the prosecutors are independent - they ca n't be ordered around by me .
that 's right .
but we are also a country , i hope , of common sense and judgment and the great thing about having independent institutions is they can exercise some independent judgment .
he said that the government has not ruled out imposing a new contract on junior doctors if an agreement can not be reached .
we ca n't rule that out [ imposing a new contract ] because we ca n't simply go into a situation where the junior doctors have a complete veto and block over progress in our nhs .
but we are talking to them in very good faith .
i think we 've settled 15 of the 16 issues that they raised .
there 's an 11 % basic pay rise on the table .
so i would urge them to get round that table and have that final negotiation .
he said the government had recently offered junior doctors an assurance that they would not have to work two saturdays in a row as part of the pay negotiations .
he repeated the government 's claim that if you have a stroke at the weekend , you are 20 % more likely to die . ''
in a letter in the sunday times yesterday , 59 leading stroke doctors said this claim was misleading .
they said that figure was out of date because it precedes rapid improvements in stroke care '' .
more patients are now treated in acute stroke units , they wrote .
they went on : recent audits of stroke outcomes in london show that there is no longer any excess of hospital deaths in patients with stroke admitted at the weekend .
cameron said the government had to look very carefully '' at the education programmes funded by saudi arabia .
the government was looking at how extremism was funded , he said .
i think if you look at what saudi arabia is doing , they have a good programme for deradicalising people who have become radicalised and terrorists .

but if at the same time , money from states is funding educational programmes that can incubate a sense that one religion is right and another one is wrong , and anti-semitic materials and what have you , then we need to look very carefully at that and that is exactly what we are doing .
i think saudi arabia and other countries know that is an area they need to look at .
he said that british military personnel working with the saudis on the controversial bombing campaign in yemen were trying to ensure that their efforts were properly targeted '' .

when it comes to yemen , we support the legitimate government of yemen and work with others in order to try and help that country have the stability that it needs we are trying to do everything we can to make sure that the work done by saudi arabia is properly targeted and that is right that we should do that .

we are working with them and others , a ) on behalf of the legitimate government in yemen , but b ) what we are always doing is trying to encourage a political process in yemen , because at the end of the day what we need in yemen is a government that can represent every part of that country .

there is no military solution in yemen , at the end of the day the parties have got to come together as they are now beginning to do so , and that is very much under the pressure that britain has put on .
he criticised the today presenter sarah montague for using the word islamic state to describe islamic state .
cameron prefers the terms isil , or daesh .
jamie angus ( @ grvlx001 ) the prime minister @ twitterid cameron is on # r4today talking to @ twitterid montague

documents.title: burnham says cameron at risk of 'unfairly stigmatising ' muslim community
text: andy burnham , the shadow home secretary , says david cameron is at risk of unfairly stigmatising '' the muslim community .
andy burnham ( @ andyburnhammp ) cameron 's simplistic , headline-driven approach to extremism risks unfairly stigmatising a whole community , thereby making the problem worse .
the ramadhan foundation , a muslim group , has put out a statement accusing david cameron of stereotyping '' muslims .
this is from mohammed shafiq , its chief executive .
david cameron and his conservative government are once again using british muslims as a political football to score cheap points to appear tough .
there are three million muslims in this country and the prime minister chooses to focus on a very small minority of extremists when clearly the majority of british muslims reject extremism .
the ramadhan foundation has been clear for many years that we face an increased risk from terrorism and an ideology of hatred .
the best way to confront it is to build support within muslims and support the work done across the country , and not lashing out and denigrating muslims .
the irony of the prime minister calling for more resources to help migrants learn english when his government cut the funding for english classes in 2011 has not been lost on many people .
this was a right-wing , neo-con prime minister delivering more of the same disgraceful stereotyping of british muslims .
boris johnson , the conservative mp and mayor of london , made his comment about the metropolitan police owing lord bramall a full apology '' in his daily telegraph column .
here is an extract .
it is pretty clear that field marshal lord bramall is owed a full and heartfelt apology .
look at what he has been through .
he is a 92-year-old veteran of d-day , who was decorated by monty for gallantry in capturing a nazi outpost .
he has served this country for decades , rising to become head of the army , and had the good sense to speak out against the iraq war in 2003 .
but in the twilight of his career he has lived under a cloud of sus - after he was accused of rape and indecent assault , between 1976 and 1984 , by a man who is anonymous and only known as nick '' .

not a shred of evidence was ever produced to support these claims , and on friday lord bramall received a brief email from the police telling him that there would be no further action '' the paradox is that it is precisely because he is an establishment figure - a kg , gcb , obe , mc , a former lord lieutenant - that the police feel they have to show a scrupulous refusal to be intimidated .
indeed , you could argue that this is a fine thing about our country , that no one is too grand to be ruthlessly investigated .
that , today , is not much consolation to lord bramall .
his accuser is surely sad but delusional .
you ca n't blame the police , in the current climate , for taking no chances .
but in this case they were plainly barking up the wrong tree .

i hope a way will be found of making amends , because being a british war hero did n't help bramall against these allegations ; on the contrary , there was a sense in which his status simply made things worse .
he deserves to put the last year behind him , and accept the continued thanks of his country .
here 's the guardian 's alan travis on david cameron 's interview .
alan travis ( @ alantravis40 ) cameron right to put more money into english lang .
teaching but wrong to link 0.27 % women who ca n't speak english with potential extremism and this is from huffington post 's paul waugh .
paul waugh ( @ paulwaugh ) compare/contrast pm : not for politicians to order cops to apologise boris ( who oversees met ) : `` bramall is owed a full + heartfelt apology ''

documents.title: cameron 's today interview - snap summary
text: i 've replaced this posted with a beef-up version at 10.06am , with all the key quotes .

documents.title: cameron suggests met should apologise to lord bramall for its abuse investigation
text: q : does lord bramall deserve an apology from the met for the way they handled the abuse allegations against him ?
cameron says bramall is a wonderful man '' with a great record .
it is not for the prime minister to tell the police what to do , he says .
but he would like to think that , if they get something wrong , they would feel big enough to say so .
q : so is that a yes ?
cameron says it is his answer .
it is not for him to tell the police what to do .
but we are a country where people should face up to things that go wrong , he suggests .
cameron suggests met should apologise to lord bramall for its abuse investigation .
and that 's it .
i will post a summary shortly .

documents.title: cameron signals he plans a new law to assert the supremacy of parliament over eu law
text: q : the sunday times said yesterday you are now proposing a new law asserting the supremacy of parliament over eu law ?
cameron says the government already asserted the supremacy of parliament in its eu referendum lock in the last parliament .
if there is a case for strengthening that , he will look at it .
q : do you think there is a case ?
yes , says cameron .
q : so have you asked michael gove to draw up plans for this ?
cameron says he will not go into his discussions with gove .
cameron signals he plans a new law to assert the supremacy of parliament over eu law .

documents.title: cameron refuses to rule out imposing new contract on junior doctors before next month 's strike
text: q : do you think junior doctors and the bma are using this as a political opportunity to attack a tory government ?
cameron says the bma can answer for themselves .
but they were telling doctors they would lose 30 % of their pay .
that was not right .
they had a pay calculator on their website , but they had to take it down because it was not accurate , he says .
he says you are 20 % more likely to die from a stroke if you go into a hospital at a weekend .
q : doctors have complained that that statistic is misleading .
cameron says people in the medical profession know there is a problem with nhs treatment at weekends .
q : will you just impose this contract on junior doctors ?
cameron says he can not rule that out .
but he hopes to get an agreement .
he is going into this in good faith .
the government has just put on the table a proposal that no junior doctor should have to work two saturdays in a row .
q : could the contract be imposed before the strike in february ?
cameron says he hopes it will not come to that .
cameron refuses to rule out imposing new contract on junior doctors before next month 's strike .
q : the saudis say we are working very closely with them in their operation in yemen .
cameron says we support the legitimate government in yemen .
and he says there are strict rules on arms exports to saudi arabia .
cameron says his plans are designed to combat isolation .
but he thinks there is a link to extremism .
q : but the people who have gone to syria have often spoken very good english .
and they have often had a good education .
cameron says that is correct .
he is not saying there is a causal connection , he says .
and he criticised montague for using the term islamic state .
q : is there a causal connection between extremism and money coming from saudi arabia ?
cameron says the government already bans the funding of extremist groups .
q : angela merkel 's deputy said saudi arabia was a danger to public security because of its funding for extremist groups .
cameron says saudi arabia is trying to tackle terrorism .
but if it is funding extremist material , we need to look carefully at that .
q : was it a mistake to cut that funding ?
no , says cameron .
we had to make difficult decisions .
q : the £ 20m funding you are announcing - is it just for women ?
yes , says cameron .
although not just muslim women - it is for women who are isolated .
q : do you approve of the full-face veil ?
cameron says people should be free to wear what they want .
but he says he supports the right of schools to have sensible rules .
he would not go for the french approach - banning an article of clothing .
q : what if a muslim woman fails this test ?
cameron says there will be no guarantee that they can stay .
if people are not improving their language , there will be no guarantee they can stay .
q : in the last parliament you cut funding for english lessons .
cameron says this programme will be better targeted .
it will go after the particular problem area .

documents.title: david cameron 's today interview
text: sarah montague is interviewing david cameron .
q : how will you find the muslim women who can not speak english ?
cameron says people will be identified locally .
there are an estimated 38,000 british muslim women who speak no english , and 190,000 who speak english badly .
from october this year women coming to the uk on a spousal visa will be tested , he says .
he says segregation is holding people back .
it is not in tune with british values and it needs to go .
david cameron is about to give an interview to the today programme .
he will be talking about plans he has flagged up in an article in the times ( paywall ) to get more muslim women to speak english .
he suggests there is a link between lack of integration and extremism .
we do n't just need a strong economy to thrive , we have to build a strong society .
segregation drives us apart , not together .
and tolerating the development of parallel communities can also mean failing to get to grips with appalling practices such as fgm and forced marriage .
there is also an important connection to extremism .
i am not saying separate development or conservative religious practices directly cause extremism .
that would be insulting to many who are devout and peace-loving .
but they can help a young person 's slide towards radicalisation .
think about the young boy growing up in bradford .
his parents came from a village in pakistan .
his mum ca n't speak english and rarely leaves the home , so he finds it hard to communicate with her , and she does n't understand what is happening in his life .
at the same time , as a teenager he is struggling to identify with western culture .
separate development and accepting practices that go against our values only emphasise differences and can help prompt the search of something to belong to .
when that happens , the extremist narrative gives him something and he explains what he wants to do about the issue .
this has to be tackled head on .
we 've already introduced a language test for new migrants , but i believe it 's time to be much more demanding .
yes , we have responsibilities to migrants , but they have responsibilities too .
at the moment , someone can move here with very basic english and there 's no requirement to improve it over time .
we will change that .
we will now say : if you do n't improve your fluency , that could affect your ability to stay in the uk .
this will help make it clear to those men who stop their partners from integrating that there are consequences .
we 'll also fund a dramatic improvement in the way we provide english language services for women .

with a new £ 20 million programme , we 'll make sure every woman from isolated communities with no english at all has access to classes , whether through community groups or further education colleges .
i will be covering the interview in detail .
here is the agenda for the day .
10am : frank field launches a report on welfare reform .
11am : number 10 lobby briefing .
2.30pm : the actor idris elba speaks at a channel 4 diversity event in parliament .

around 4.30pm : mps begin a debate in westminster hall on donald trump as usual , i will also be covering breaking political news as it happens , as well as bringing you the best reaction , comment and analysis from the web .
i will post a summary at lunchtime and another in the afternoon .
if you want to follow me or contact me on twitter , i 'm on @ andrewsparrow .
i try to monitor the comments btl but normally i find it impossible to read them all .
if you have a direct question , do include andrew '' in it somewhere and i 'm more likely to find it .
i do try to answer direct questions , although sometimes i miss them or do n't have time .
alternatively you could post a question to me on twitter .

bulletin.text: Rolling coverage of all the day's political developments as they happen, including David Cameron's interview on the Today programme.
